Package sample

Class AddAppointmentController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.AddAppointmentController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AddAppointmentController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class allows the user to schedule new appointments. Users can select an existing customer from the database to make appointments for. Data for new appointments is collected via textfields and comboboxes.

      • getCustomerList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> getCustomerList()
        Returns:
        Returns array list of customer data (id, name, address, postal code, phone, division id)

      • getContactsList

        public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Contacts> getContactsList()
        Returns:
        Returns an array of contact data (contact id, contact name, contact email)

                           throws java.io.IOException

      • selectCustomerButtonClick

        public void selectCustomerButtonClick​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method allows the user to select an existing customer to make an appointment for. Upon clicking, customer name and id are retrieved, so as to allow the user to make appointments for the selected customer.
        Parameters:
        event - (mouse click on select customer button)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • validateFields

        public boolean validateFields​(boolean isValid)
        This method checks to make sure the user has filled out all textfields, and also checks to see if comboboxes were selected correctly as well.

      • preparedInsert

        public void preparedInsert()
        This method creates a new appointment and adds it to the database via a prepared statement.

      • addAppointmentButtonClick

        public void addAppointmentButtonClick​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        This method allows the user to save new appointment information, so long as the data the user provided is valid
        Parameters:
        event - (mouse click Save Button)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • checkApptOverlap

        public boolean checkApptOverlap()
        This method tests if the new appointment to be scheduled overlaps with an existing appointment on record.
        Returns:
        Returns match that contains a boolean value. True if there is an overlapping appointment. False if there are no matches.

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle rb)
        This method initializes the add appointment screen. It populates both the customer and contact tables. And sets the localdatetime options for the user to select appointment times in comboboxes.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url -
        rb -
